intro: Xylosma kaalaensis, commonly known as the Kaala xylosma, is a shrub or small tree native to parts of Africa, particularly in Kenya and Tanzania. It belongs to the Rhamnaceae family and is characterized by its small, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in clusters, followed by small, woody fruits that contain a single seed. It is adapted to dry and semi-arid environments, making it a hardy species found in savanna and woodland habitats.
